Better Relations  +  Higher Achievement  +  Greater Impact

The Berkeley Emotional Quotients and Index (BEQI) is an open research project created at the Sutardja Center for Entrepeneurship & technology (SCET) at UC Berkeley.  BEQI [bek-ee],has been designed to measure a person's ability to recognize, label, and enact change in response to their own emotions and those of others (perceived or anticipated). BEQI is also used to analyse how emotional awareness influences thinking & behavior, and how this awareness is translated into actions that lead to environments or processes that are better at promoting and achieving one's goal(s).
Individual Emotional Intelligence Report 
 
Your Personal Emotional Awareness and Application Aptitude Level is Currently:  OUT OF 10. 
The following factors are components of your interpersonal and intrapersonal intelligence level: 
SELF AWARENESS:   OUT OF 10.   This meassure captures your ability to recognize and understand your strengths, weaknesses, emotions, needs and drives.  Self Awareness is essential for dealing with the external effects of internal states (and vice versa), and is fundamental in achieving long term goals.   A high self awareness score is indicative of positive traits such as confidence, assertieness, and is associated with reduced procrastination and avoidance of difficult topics and people.  
SELF REGULATION:  OUT OF 10.   This metric represents your capacity to control your feelings and impulses, and in turn create environements of trust and fairness.  Becasue self regulation modulates your emotion and response to stressors, it plays an essential role in achieving, and managing immediate and long term goals/risks.  High self regulation scores are associated with increased reflection prior to actions, decreased procrastination, and higher productivity that is often carried downstream. 
MOTIVATION:   OUT OF 10.   Motivation measures your drive to achieve beyond expecations -- beyond grades, salary, and prestige.  Motivation is closely associated with leadership skills, as well as with the dedicated persuit of goals despite setbacks.  A high motivation score is required for those that want to lead, as it is often esxhibited in aspirational ways while also being firmly rooted in the processes required to achieve goals. 
EMPATHY:   OUT OF 10.   Empathy measures your willingness to thoughtfully consider other's feelings, along with other factors in the process of making intelligent decisions.  Empathy tends to be most strongly represented on people that are sensitive to cultural and ethical differences. People with high empathy are stongly suited to acting as mediators/translators between people, particularly under new and/or stressful situations. 
SOCIAL SKILLS:   OUT OF 10.   This measure quantifies your mastery of social interactions in order to achieve goals -- i.e. your friendliness with a purpose.  Social skill is assocaited with the succesful managing of teams, and in the persuading of others onto his/her side.   People with high social skills tend to have wide social networks, a knack for finding common ground with all kinds of peole and, most importatly, are adept at deplyig them to tackle problems and challenges. 
 
This is not a fixed level, anyone can learn to nurture their emotional awareness and actively grow their emotional intelligence. 

Your BEQI level has been estimated based on the Berkeley Method for Entreprenuership & Innovation, the Emotional Quotient scale, and fundamental testing methods in the field of Psychology and Social Psychology.

  It's hard to improve upon what can't be measured.
The Berkeley Innovation Index (BII) is a set of online assessments designed to enable people, workgroups, and organizations to measure their attitudes, beliefs and behaviors -- in order to learn how they are correlated with those of successful entrepreneurs, leaders, and innovators. BII promotes research and builds tools to help people, and firms, understand their current capacity for innovation, to diagnose their innovation challenges and managerial lacks, as well as to promote the growth of emotional intelligence and the development of an innovation mindset .

If your team needs comprehensive attention, we are always looking for new collaborators. Moreover, all of our tools can be tailored to the specific needs of your firm. We measure, quantify, report, and counsel you through your improvement process.
TEAMS + CONSULTING + COLLABORATION
Please read this notice carefully before reviewing the contents herein.

The Berkeley Innovation Index (BII) is a set of online assessments designed to enable people, workgroups, and organizations to measure their attitudes, beliefs and behaviors in order to learn how they are correlated with those of successful entrepreneurs and innovators. BII assessments are designed to help people understand their current capacity for innovation, to diagnose their innovation challenges, and to enable the development of an innovation mindset. By completion of a survey and receipt of this email, you have agreed to the following: (1) That you will only use these Assessments in the manner for which they are designed. (2) That your use of these Assessments is for legitimate purposes only. (3) You agree not to use Assessment results to cause or intend to cause distress or harm to any third party. (4) That you will not copy, redistribute, disassemble, decompile, modify or merge the contents of this assessment into other materials. Moreover, you agree to indemnify and hold the University of California, Berkeley; the Sutardja Center for Entrepreneurship & Innovation (SCET) and members of the SCET team; the Berkeley Innovation Index (BII) and members of the BII team; and all of their affiliates harmless from, and to defend against any and all liability and costs, including reasonable attorney’s fees incurred by such parties, in connection with or arising out of your (A) violation or breach of any term of this agreement, or any applicable law or regulation, whether or not referenced herein, or (B) violation of any rights of any third party, or (C) misuse of these assessments.

ABOUT THE BERKELEY EMOTIONAL QUOTIENTS AND INDEX (BEQI).

BEQI is based on the research and implementation of the Emotional Quotient (EQ), also known as EI, or EIQ, as carried out by Michael Beldoch and popularized by Daniel Goleman.
